title: Gallar
author: Gallar
content: I'm trying to learn to send Merit for the first time. I originally wanted to send 1 merit. but instead I made the mistake of sending 11 Merits. can I cancel the delivery of the Merit? and how to do it?Thank you

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Quote from: Gallar on November 04, 2022, 12:13:26 AMI'm trying to learn to send Merit for the first time. I originally wanted to send 1 merit. but instead I made the mistake of sending 11 Merits. can I cancel the delivery of the Merit? and how to do it?Thank youNope, sorry..

comments.author: Apocollapse
comments.body: sMerit can't be cancelled or reversed, similar like Bitcoin transaction. I think you can made a topic for this mistake on Reputation section and tell to everyone why you can send 11 merits to that's post, since 11 merits is too large for such post. Some people who see that's post must feel weird if the user get 11 merits and you could be in trouble since you're abusing Merit system.

comments.author: Pandu Geddon
comments.body: OP, sorry but how did you find that person's post and distribute your 11 sMerit today?the post was made early last month. and its position is in the middle of the thread.just my assumption, you are trying to help the account to rank up faster by giving Merit.but if it is indeed your fault for trying to send Merit, you can create a thread on Reputation to explain your mistake. never be afraid if you are doing something right.

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: Gallar on November 04, 2022, 12:13:26 AMI'm trying to learn to send Merit for the first time. I originally wanted to send 1 merit. but instead I made the mistake of sending 11 Merits. can I cancel the delivery of the Merit? and how to do it?Thank youClick on Merit button, you will see the given warning information like thisQuoteYou have received a total of 22 merit. This is what determines your forum rank. You typically cannot lose this merit. You have 11 sendable merit (sMerit) which you can send to other people. There is no point in hoarding sMerit; keeping it yourself does not benefit you, and we reserve the right to decay unused sMerit in the future.At the bottom, you will see the warning!QuoteThis cannot be undone!Unfortunately, I checked and saw you just sent 11 smerit. It means now you have 0 smerit to send out.If you want to learn more about the merit system and how to use your sendable merit (sMerit), please readMerit & new rank requirements

comments.author: ThemePen
comments.body: Unfortunately you can't recover them. You have sent 11 merits to this person. BRINIRHA and due to your given merits he/she got the Full Member rank. Luckily he/she got this. Your mistake was a lucky moment for him/her. Be careful for the next time.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: It can't be cancelled. It can't be reversed. But I was expecting the error to be different. 10 merits is more likely to be erroneously sent than 11. The merit box has by default a number 0 inside it. If you click the box, the number 0 won't disappear or at least automatically highlighted so that it would be replaced by the number you want to put. For a number of times, I almost committed the mistake of sending 10 merits instead of only 1 because of this. Double-checking helped every time. But I think there have been a number of instances in which 10 was sent instead of 1. Unlucky for you, OP, you've got exactly 11 sMerits. Had you only have 10, it would only have resulted in an error.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Just be careful next time. Adding reversibility to sMerits would add just too much unnecessary complications within the forum and ranking system.Fun fact: I was once browsing the forums while intoxicated, and accidentally reported a post with a comment "1" instead of giving 1 merit.

comments.author: BRINIRHA
comments.body: Quote from: Gallar on November 04, 2022, 12:13:26 AMI'm trying to learn to send Merit for the first time. I originally wanted to send 1 merit. but instead I made the mistake of sending 11 Merits. can I cancel the delivery of the Merit? and how to do it?Thank youthis is the first time I have obtained Merit with a flustered feeling. should i be happy or not. because it turns out you sent it wrong.before finding this post of yours. comments.author: Woodie
comments.body: Quote from: Gallar on November 04, 2022, 12:13:26 AMI'm trying to learn to send Merit for the first time. I originally wanted to send 1 merit. but instead I made the mistake of sending 11 Merits. can I cancel the delivery of the Merit? and how to do it?Thank you"can sending smerit be cancelled?"Short answer: No it can not, its a one way street!Long answer: For starters, there is a difference between merit and smerit, merit can not e transferred to another user while smerit is transferable/ sendable. It's the smerit that is needed to offset an increase in merit which in turn allows one to rank up while merit on the other hand does not decrease but only goes up per smerit received. For more information on how the merit system works check the following thread https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=2818350.0

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: Quote from: hosseinimr93 on November 04, 2022, 08:10:27 AMBut generally speaking, if I send you 10 merit and tell you "I sent 10 merit to you and now I don't have any smerit. Can you please send me 5 merit?", it would be still merit exchange.Merit exchange is not rarely seen on the forum.Assumption:You can apply to be a merit source and get attraction of other users who will naturally or shadily exchange merit with you. It's hard or easy to judge a merit exchange based on how quality that merited posts are and the frequency of backscratching between two users or between a merit source and their local users.If the merited posts are not too good quality but still receiving merits, and the frequency is high, that is merit exchange.If the merited posts are good in quality, it is good to not consider it as merit exchange.My motto is "Your total earned merit does not tell others who you are and your qualitative contribution, but your post quality does."
